intro: Dichoespermum juncoides, commonly known as the water cowbean, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous, aquatic or semi-aquatic growth habit. The plant features slender, cylindrical stems that often grow in wetlands or along water bodies. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are arranged in spikes, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Dichoespermum juncoides is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance in wetland ecosystems.
